\documentclass[english]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[latin9]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath}

\makeatletter

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% LyX specific LaTeX commands.
%% Because html converters don't know tabularnewline
\providecommand{\tabularnewline}{\\}

\makeatother

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\begin{table}\label{tab:Estimates_MAR1full}
\begin{centering}
\begin{tabular}{lllll}
\hline 
Parameter  & value & SE & lower 95\% CI & upper 95\% CI\tabularnewline
\hline 
$b_{11}$ &  0.7710 & 0.11129 &  0.5528321 &  0.98908\tabularnewline
$b_{21}$ &  0.2150 & 0.10961 &  0.0001838 &  0.42984\tabularnewline
$b_{12}$ & -0.2333 & 0.11142 & -0.4516968 & -0.01495\tabularnewline
$b_{22}$ &  0.6601 & 0.10976 &  0.4449659 &  0.87520\tabularnewline
$\sigma_{1}^{2}$ &  0.3961 & 0.07747 &  0.2280603 &  0.61035\tabularnewline
$\sigma_{2}^{2}$ &  0.3844 & 0.07631 &  0.2212871 &  0.59222\tabularnewline
\hline 
\end{tabular}
\par\end{centering}

\caption{Estimates of the MAR(1) full model, without environmental covariates,
$\mathbf{x_{t+1}}=\mathbf{Bx_{t}}\mathbf{+e_{t}},\mathbf{e_{t}}\sim\mathcal{N}_{2}(0,\mathbf{\Sigma})$,
with interaction matrix $\mathbf{B}=\begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12}\protect\\
b_{21} & b_{22}^{(1)}
\end{pmatrix}$ and error matrix $\Sigma=\begin{pmatrix}\sigma_{1}^{2} & 0\protect\\
0 & \sigma_{2}^{2}
\end{pmatrix}$ . The off-diagonal interaction coefficients are statistically significant
at a 95\% level. Similar results are obtained for non-diagonal $\Sigma$
(not shown); for parsimony we use a diagonal error matrix. }
\end{table}

\end{document}
